result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs.
 Pay a $100.00 fine. Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and fine by 11-04-2019 to convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Count 1; with 262 days credit
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts one, two and three and to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

Defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant entered a change in pleah.   As to Count 5:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
As to Count 4:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  360 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 262 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 1.
Court orders restitution set at $0.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered a $100.00 fine.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and fine by 11/4/2019 to convert to a civil judgment . 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed:

CASE HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE ROSA

Defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Sentencing proceeded.  
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Statements by state, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  25 YEARS with  262 days credit CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 2 AND 3 and consecutive to any other sentence.
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is  15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.    

AS TO COUNT 2
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  25 YEARS  with 262 days credit; CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 1 AND 3 and consecutive to any other sentence
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  25 YEARS with 262 days credit; CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 and consecutive to any other sentence
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 6
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with ZERO days credit; CONSECUTIVE TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3 and to any other sentence.
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent.   
Maintain Absolute Sobriety
Random Urine screenings
Provide DNA Sample

Restitutuion set at Zero.

DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE ROSA.....
Defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Jack McKenzie Wingo in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


 At the hour of 11:16 AM, the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:

Count 1:  GUILTY
Count 2:  GUILTY
Count 3:  GUILTY
Count 4:  GUILTY

which was then read.  
Court polled and discharged the jury.  
4 Verdicts received and filed.  
Jury out of box at 11:25 AM.

**Court returned Count #4 as its original count, Count #6.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to Count #s 1, 2, 3, and 6.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
